description:
Get ready for a new collection of stories from Ranking of Kings!

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: อันดับพระราชา
Ranking of Kings: Le Trésor du Courage

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Language Barrier
tags.description: A barrier to communication between people who are unable to speak a common language.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nonoo9999999) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=atsuko_nozaki)

Originating from [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/). Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/253545/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nonoo9999999) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=atsuko_nozaki)

Originating from [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/). Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [older animator](https://anilist.co/staff/253545/)._
Started off as an animator at [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) in the late '80s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mathimekomachi) 

Animation Producer at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Yoshimichi Kameda](https://anilist.co/staff/105635)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PPP_PEOPLE1) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ppppeople1/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLDLOuvdOfw6X2pLs1xSL0g) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2llRPLPOCvnAiUozItvPsU)__

__PEOPLE 1__ is a Japanese rock band created in 2019.

__Members:__
- [Deu](https://anilist.co/staff/192618) – Lyricist, Vocalist, Composer, Arranger, Guitarist, Bassist
- Takeuchi – Drummer
- Ito – Guitarist, Vocalist

[Website](http://www.aimer-web.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimer_and_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimer_0907_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCR1zT1s524Hbc85bdvno_8w)

A Japanese pop singer and lyricist signed to SME Records and managed by FOURseam. Her name comes from the verb "aimer" in French which means "to love." She is known for being a faceless voice. She very rarely appears on her music videos and most of her live performances are dimly lit to obscure her face. She finally revealed herself on the August 20, 2016 episode of Music Station.

Her father was the bassist of a band, so Aimer grew up surrounded by music from a very young age. She began studying the piano in elementary school and highly looked up to Ringo Sheena and Utada Hikaru. In junior high school, listening to Avril Lavigne inspired her to take up guitar and began writing English lyrics. At the age of 15, Aimer lost her voice due to over-usage of her vocal cords and was forced to undergo silence therapy for treatment. However, that did not stop her, and after she recovered, she acquired her distinctive husky voice.

Aimer teamed up with the "Agehasprings" group, which has worked with, produced, or provided music for various artists, including Yuki, Mika Nakashima, Flumpool, Superfly, Yuzu, and Genki Rockets. In 2011, her musical career began in earnest. In May 2011, they released the concept album "Your Favorite Things." It covered numerous popular works, including works in various genre such as jazz and country western music.

Married [Masahiro Tobinai](https://anilist.co/staff/146979/Masahiro-Tobinai) in 2023.
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gwada_wit)

President of [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Co-founder and representative director of [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
